title: Software Engineer
description: Primary Developer of Android, and iOS Applications, Django-based Server, and Fleet Management System.
Designed and implemented secure communication protocols between cloud services, firmware, and client apps.
Developed IoT firmware for cross-platform compatibility and implemented theft detection and prevention algorithms.
Implemented new features and bug fixes to enhance user experience and functionality.
Automated CI/CD pipeline with Docker, Heroku, and AWS for efficient deployment and scaling.
Created a Unified Telemetry Gateway System, simplifying fleet management by integrating various vehicle providers into a single portal.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
description: CS5800 Algorithms - Summer '22 and Fall '22
Conducted weekly tutoring sessions on the prerequisites of the course and advanced topics like Dynamic Programming, Greedy, Graphs, Max Flows and NP-Completeness.
Graded weekly assignments on Gradescope and led code-walks for programming assignments.
Contributed to the content curation by providing solutions and codes for future iteratons of the course.

title: Software R&D Engineer
description: Developed of Samsung Email Application primarily involving Email Protocols with emphasis on Exchange ActiveSync protocol and Account Setup module using Android Sync Service and SQLite Database.
Implemented device policies through Email App for data security of organizations.
Upgraded UX and UI as per version and OS upgrades (primarily android Q and R OS), debugging complex problems, defect fixing, and incident handling.
Scripted Android Espresso test cases and Python Robodroid Automation using robot framework and Jenkins server.
Contributed to other modules including Email Composure, Widget and Samsung Gear Email.

title: Software R&D Intern
description: Innovated the idea of a payment recommendation engine by integrating Samsung Pay with Samsung Email application.

Created a Classification software of transactional mails with Naive Bayes classifier and also with Artificial Neural Network and compared the accuracy from both. The process also involved Data gathering and refining.
Implemented the TensorFlow Lite model into the Email App to redirect and autofill the amount on Samsung Pay.

title: Summer Research Intern
description: Implemented a method for Gujarati Script Character Pre-processing to be further processed by OCR.
Gathered data of Gujarati handwritten and printed documents.
Applied various refining methods like Skew Detection and Correction, Line Segmentation, Middle Zone Extraction, and Character Segmentation using OpenCV, Numpy, Scipy and Python Imaging Library.

title: Rural Internship
place: Himalayan Institute for Environment, Ecology and Development, Uttarakhand, India
description: Developed an Android Application as a measure to mitigate climate change and Disaster Risk Reduction. The purpose was to aid in dissemination of information necessary during natural disasters.
Studied the current perception of villagers towards disasters through survey research.
